content.raw:
Just a quick comment here: the problem is not that real functional/system tests take some time. They take, for sure. When someone is developing usually is not part of normal development to run the function/system, which should be done by a test machine or a tester. After make a change it is mandatory to run the unit test suite which should run fast, in terms of seconds probably.

I'm afraid that setting here the updateRate to 0 drive us to a "not so real" functional test case.
The test migration and rework process is in progress and should fix this kind of issues.
